bug.short_desc: Cannot load module due to module's .la file missing

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: With recent change the *.la files in %{_libdir} and its subdirectories are missing. Therefore, it is impossible to moduleload a module in slapd.conf.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): openldap-servers-2.4.43-3.fc24
How reproducible: Always - just after installation.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install the openldap-servers package. 2. Try to load a module with moduleload option in /etc/openldap/slapd.conf. 3. The chosen module is not found.
Actual results: lt_dlopenext failed: (accesslog) file not found
Expected results: slapd starts without error
Additional info: According to Fedora Packaging Guidelines [1] .la files should not be distributed with packages. As OpenLDAP tries to load the .so files directly, too, including these might be currently the best way to fix this.
[1] https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Guidelines?rd=Packaging/Guidelines#Packaging_Static_Libraries
